chunks.en: Writing code in Hangzhou, can't afford a house, very confused.
Feels like I'm not earning enough. After calculating, I only saved 70,000 RMB a year after expenses.
Currently 25, writing Java in Hangzhou, very confused, can't afford a house.
No house, no car, no partner, and don't know where to go in the future.

There are many things you can do: 1. Go on Xiaohongshu, post 'seeking advice', ask people to guide you to change your image, strengthen your body, learn how to dress. 2. Learn about financial management, read more books like 'Rich Dad Poor Dad' and 'Invest for Ten Years to Achieve Financial Freedom', pay attention to the stock market, and seize cyclical opportunities. 3. Declutter, live a minimalist lifestyle, buy good things when needed, and don't buy things you don't need. 4. Learn about interpersonal and social skills, improve your emotional intelligence, and don't be silent when introduced to potential partners. 5. Most importantly, strengthen your professional skills and find a higher-paying job. Don't always think about eventually buying a house and getting married, first pursue a more comfortable life and more wealth, opportunities may come unexpectedly.
You are only 25, a beautiful age, and you are already being tied down by these things, it seems that real estate prices will have to rise sharply!
When I was 25, I saved 100,000 RMB a year, but after I got a girlfriend, I could only save 50,000 RMB a year.

chunks.en: You are very young. When I was 25, I was still just playing games all the time. Although I'm not doing great now, at least I have a 30-year mortgage. Sigh, it seems you are more free. What I really want to say is: because you are not trapped, you can still get up and go to other places for a change of scenery and see the world. Who says that where you work now you must be tied to that place in the future?

Houses in the Qingshan Lake Science and Technology Park are just over 1 million, and a down payment of 200,000 to 300,000 RMB is enough to get started, or even a 0 down payment. Cars like the BYD 798 and Wuling Starlight 998 have interest-free loans. Be bold and you can have a house and a car soon.ğŸ¶

Your salary will increase in the future, and the amount of money you save in a year will be many times more than now. Don't worry about such heavy things for now, and enjoy life. You can leave the saving to your future self in three to five years, and now you should just enjoy yourself. Date, travel, and experience different things.

Think positively, in 2000, the economy of Hangzhou was far inferior to Ningbo and Wenzhou on the coast. In 1860, during the two battles of Hangzhou, the population of Hangzhou city plummeted from 600,000 to 70,000. In 605, the Xianbei conqueror emperor conscripted 2 million people per month to dig the canal, laying the pipeline for economic plundering to the Hangjiahu Plain. Just as the Xianbei emperor's father created the imperial examination system, laying the pipeline for talent plundering to the conquered land. Everything is possible, accumulate more skills, customers, and money, life is not necessarily tied to one city.

chunks.en: You are still young, and now house prices are also falling, what are you worried about... We were really worried when we missed the wave in 2015. With your situation, save money steadily for a few years. It's hard to say whether house prices will fall sharply in the next few years, but they definitely won't rise sharply. At 25, this golden development period, your life may be completely different in a few years, do what you should do. If you really can't afford to buy in Hangzhou, go to Changsha, you can always afford a few thousand RMB there.

Search on Zhihu for 'Why are young people unwilling to buy houses?' There is also another question, probably asked in 2018, asking what to do if you feel that you have been left behind by your peers because you didn't buy a house - the answers to this question have basically reversed now. The last era has ended, and you are still asking if you can't afford a house, shouldn't you be glad that your family didn't empty six wallets to force you into a 30-year mortgage?

Still thinking about buying a house? Rent a brand new small two-bedroom apartment for 3000 yuan, live in it for 3 years and change to the next one, 0 risk, always living in a new house, isn't that great?

@HiCode I have always felt that Chinese real estate is mother-in-law economics, and has nothing to do with the end of an era. Not getting married is the best, if you want to get married, you have to obediently lower your head and pay for a wedding house.

At 25, my family paid the down payment, and then I have been a slave to the mortgage. The mortgage almost accounts for half a month's salary. I saved the remaining money for a year or two and then finished the decoration. I saved for another year or two and then finished the commercial-to-public conversion.
Isn't the current trend not getting married, not buying a house, not having children, and not consuming? Where does the confusion come from?
